name: indole-3-ol,acetate ester
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base melting point is around 106°C. The indole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-system, estimated at around +20 °C for each additional pi-system component. The acetate group introduces a carbonyl-like functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 °C. The ethyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular volume, estimated at around -5 °C. The piperidine ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 °C. The presence of these functional groups in indole-3-ol acetate will increase the melting point due to the additional rigid structures and hydrogen bonding potential.
